name: CAIR FOUNDATION INC
mission: Communications Department works in conjunction with local and national media to ensure an accurate portrayal of Islam and Muslims is presented to the American public.
theoryOfChange: CAIR uses a combination of legal defense, media monitoring, and government lobbying to protect constitutional rights and shift the public narrative around Islam.
zakatClaimEvidence: CAIR's work is tax-deductible and zakat eligible. Donors are explicitly invited to "DEDICATE YOUR ZAKAT TO JUSTICE" for various programs. The organization also has a dedicated page titled "Donate Your Zakat to CAIR Foundation". (Source: https://www.cair.com/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: ADVOCACY (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: CAIR FOUNDATION INC shows good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 98.33/100 rating and holds 11.4 months of working capital.
Total revenue reached $7,942,722 with a program expense ratio of 66.4%.
The organization provides options for Zakat-eligible donations.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains excellent financial health and transparency ratings, though its overall score is moderated by its specific focus on advocacy and capacity building rather than direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 66.4% is lower than some peer advocacy organizations
Limited direct cost-per-beneficiary data for impact assessment

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Zakat-eligible organization, it provides a specialized platform for donors interested in civil rights advocacy and media representation [3]. The alignment score reflects a balanced track record in a high-urgency cause area, though donor fit may vary based on individual philanthropic priorities regarding advocacy versus direct aid [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a high level of organizational capacity, maintaining 11.4 months of working capital to sustain its advocacy and research programs [1][2]. While it maintains a high Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100, its impact is primarily measured through capacity building and media influence rather than direct service metrics [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: CAIR Foundation Inc. serves as a leading advocate for the accurate portrayal of Islam and the protection of Muslim civil rights in the United States.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100
Strong liquidity with 11.4 months of working capital
Efficient fundraising operations at $0.19 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: The CAIR Foundation Inc. operates a multi-faceted approach to advocacy through civil rights defense, media relations, and research programs [2]. The organization focuses on ensuring an accurate portrayal of Muslims in American media while providing legal and advocacy support to the community [1][2].

alignment.explanation: The organization is a strong fit for those prioritizing <cite id="22">Muslim civil rights</cite> and offers <cite id="23">zakat-eligible giving options</cite>.
alignment.improvement: The charity could <cite id="24">clarify its zakat allocation policy</cite> and specific eligible use categories to better serve Muslim donors.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust CAIR due to its <cite id="5">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and <cite id="14">88% independent board</cite>, which ensures rigorous oversight of its <cite id="4">$7.9 million in revenue</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could publish more granular <cite id="17">impact reports with specific beneficiary data</cite>.

impact.explanation: Operations are efficient with a <cite id="8">program expense ratio of 66.4%</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="21">peer median of 77.5%</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact assessment would benefit from <cite id="17">publishing beneficiary counts consistently</cite> to allow for cost-effectiveness analysis.

rich_narrative.headline: CAIR Foundation Inc. serves as a leading advocate for the accurate portrayal of Islam and the protection of Muslim civil rights in the United States.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize protecting the civil liberties of American Muslims and want to fund systemic advocacy and legal defense through a highly transparent, zakat-eligible institution.
donor_motivations: Want to combat Islamophobia through media and government relations
Value legal protection for Muslims facing discrimination
Prefer supporting established national organizations with high transparency ratings
Seek to fulfill zakat through advocacy (fisabilillah)
giving_considerations: Advocacy impact is often long-term and harder to quantify than direct aid
The organization has strong financial reserves, indicating long-term sustainability
Donations support a wide range of programs from media to legal services
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate, quantifiable humanitarian metrics (e.g., meals provided) or those focused on international relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while the organization <cite id="25">tracks 4 outcome metrics</cite>, it lacks rigorous external evaluations or cost-per-beneficiary data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CAIR creates impact by providing legal services to victims of discrimination, engaging media to correct narratives, and lobbying for policy changes to protect Muslim civil rights.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in advocacy ensures that legal and media strategies are effectively moving the needle on public perception and civil rights protections.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a leading national advocate, CAIR has the infrastructure to scale its legal and media response teams to meet increasing civil rights challenges.

peer_comparison.differentiator: CAIR's <cite id="8">66.4% program ratio</cite> is notably higher than the <cite id="21">peer median of 77.5%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains an <cite id="6">overall score of 98.98.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, supported by a <cite id="10">98/100 score in Accountability & Finance</cite>.
CAIR holds <cite id="7">11.4 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring stability for its <cite id="11">civil rights and media programs</cite>.
The foundation demonstrates high efficiency, spending only <cite id="12">$0.19 per $1 raised</cite> to support its national operations.

strengths_deep_dive: CAIR's organizational strength is rooted in its long-standing presence and comprehensive service model. With over <cite id="13">30 years of operating history</cite>, it has developed a sophisticated <cite id="14">independent board where 88% of members</cite> are independent. This governance structure supports a wide array of programs, including <cite id="15">government affairs and education</cite>, which are vital for systemic change. Furthermore, the organization has achieved <cite id="16">perfect 100/100 scores in Culture & Community and Leadership & Adaptability</cite> from third-party evaluators, reflecting a healthy internal environment and strategic clarity.
rich_narrative.summary: The CAIR Foundation Inc. is a prominent civil rights and advocacy organization established to protect the constitutional rights of Muslims in America. Since its <cite id="1">founding in 1994</cite>, the organization has grown into a national leader in <cite id="2">civil rights defense, media relations, and civic engagement</cite>. CAIR operates with a mission to enhance the understanding of Islam and empower American Muslims through legal services and political advocacy. Financially, the organization demonstrated significant growth with a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 13.6%</cite>, reaching <cite id="4">total revenue of $7,942,722</cite> in the 2023 tax year. The foundation maintains a high level of transparency, evidenced by its <cite id="5">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and an <cite id="6">overall score of 98.98.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Its operations are characterized by strong fiscal health, including <cite id="7">11.4 months of working capital</cite>, providing a resilient buffer for its long-term advocacy goals. While its <cite id="8">program expense ratio is reported at 66.4%</cite> in recent filings, the organization continues to invest in the infrastructure necessary to challenge Islamophobia and provide <cite id="9">legal support to underserved populations</cite> across the United States.
